key_insight: AnyTask automates the end-to-end creation of diverse simulated tasks, scenes, and expert demonstrations at massive GPU scale to produce large, high-quality datasets for training robust sim-to-real robot policies, greatly reducing manual effort.
problem_solved: Human effort and cost in designing simulation tasks, generating task-aware scenes, synthesizing demonstrations, and tuning sim-to-real transfer — which bottleneck large-scale generalist robot learning.
method: Massively parallel GPU-based simulation to spawn many task variants and scenes automatically.
Procedural task and scene generation combined with synthetic expert demonstration synthesis (e.g., scripted or learned controllers) to create labeled interaction data.
Automated sim-to-real transfer techniques (domain randomization / adaptation, curriculum scheduling) to produce policies that generalize to real-world robots.
impact: Enables scalable, low-cost data generation for training generalist robot policies, accelerating research and deployment of sim-to-real systems by reducing manual design and annotation bottlenecks.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: automated loop from task spec → procedural scene gen → parallel GPU simulation → demo synthesis → policy training → sim-to-real deployment

Icon set: GPU cluster, robot arm, dataset/demo clip, domain-randomization slider to represent core components
paper_title: AnyTask: an Automated Task and Data Generation Framework for Advancing Sim-to-Real Policy Learning
paper_authors: Ran Gong, Xiaohan Zhang, Jinghuan Shang, Maria Vittoria Minniti, Jigarkumar Patel
